articles.title: A Halloween Treat: NASA's Juno Mission Glimpses an Eerie “Face” on Jupiter - SciTechDaily
articles.description: During its 54th flyby, NASA's Juno captured an image of Jupiter's Jet N7 region, revealing turbulent clouds and the planet's terminator. Processed by Vladimir Tarasov, this image has intrigued scientists and displayed pareidolia effects. Juno's Stunning Captu…
articles.content:
ByJet Propulsion LaboratoryOctober 28, 2023

articles.title: Mangalyaan-2 mission: India’s next step towards Mars - HT Tech
articles.description: India is progressing fast in the realm of space exploration. After Chandrayaan-3, Aditya-L1, and Gaganyaan, the Indian space agency ISRO is now aiming for its next phase of the Mangalyaan mission.

articles.title: Chandrayaan-3 mission: Vikram lander removed massive 2.06 tonnes of soil on Moon’s surface - HT Tech
articles.description: Chandrayaan-3 mission marked a historic stepping stone in the field of space exploration. Now, ISRO has revealed a new achievement by Vikram Lander.

articles.title: Solar storm strike possible soon, as solar wind stream rushes towards Earth; NASA reveals its origin - HT Tech
articles.description: A new forecast predicts a solar storm on Earth on October 30, as a stream of high-velocity solar winds is moving towards our planet. The solar storm is coming from a large hole on the Sun, as shown by NASA SDO.
articles.content: Just a couple of days ago, a sneaky solar storm struck the Earth, sparking auroras in the Arctic Circle. The reason for the storm was not known since no coronal mass ejection (CME) was expected to hi… [+2160 chars]

articles.title: Rock Solid Carbon Capture: How Farmland Can Fight Global Warming - SciTechDaily
articles.description: Field test finds carbon stored in soils even in dry climates. Adding crushed volcanic rock to cropland could play a key role in removing carbon from the air. In a field study, scientists at the University of California, Davis, and Cornell University found the…
articles.content: Scientists from UC Davis and Cornell University have discovered that applying crushed volcanic rock to croplands can store carbon in soil, even in drought-prone regions like California. This enhanced… [+4324 chars]
